content: <ns0:DIF xmlns:ns0="http://gcmd.gsfc.nasa.gov/Aboutus/xml/dif/"          xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"          xsi:schemaLocation="http://gcmd.gsfc.nasa.gov/Aboutus/xml/dif/ http://gcmd.gsfc.nasa.gov/Aboutus/xml/dif/dif_v9.4.xsd">    <ns0:Entry_ID>dassh.ac.uk:DIF:2014-026</ns0:Entry_ID>    <ns0:Entry_Title>2014-026 Teeside Geophysical Survey Charting and Reporting</ns0:Entry_Title>    <ns0:Parameters>       <ns0:Category/>       <ns0:Topic/>       <ns0:Term>Marine Environmental Data and Information Network</ns0:Term>    </ns0:Parameters>    <ns0:Parameters>       <ns0:Category/>       <ns0:Topic/>       <ns0:Term>data.gov.uk</ns0:Term>    </ns0:Parameters>    <ns0:Parameters>       <ns0:Category/>       <ns0:Topic/>       <ns0:Term>Elevation Geology Hydrography Land cover</ns0:Term>    </ns0:Parameters>    <ns0:Parameters>       <ns0:Category/>       <ns0:Topic/>       <ns0:Term>Bathymetry and Elevation Sedimentary structure Side-scan sonar</ns0:Term>    </ns0:Parameters>    <ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>elevation geoscientificInformation inlandWaters imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>    <ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>elevation geoscientificInformation inlandWaters imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>    <ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>elevation geoscientificInformation inlandWaters imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>    <ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>elevation geoscientificInformation inlandWaters imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</ns0:ISO_Topic_Category>    <ns0:Keyword>Marine Environmental Data and Information Network</ns0:Keyword>    <ns0:Keyword>data.gov.uk</ns0:Keyword>    <ns0:Keyword>Elevation Geology Hydrography Land cover</ns0:Keyword>    <ns0:Keyword>Bathymetry and Elevation Sedimentary structure Side-scan sonar</ns0:Keyword>    <Source_Name xmlns="http://gcmd.gsfc.nasa.gov/Aboutus/xml/dif/">       <Short_Name>NOTE! This GCMD DIF has been produced automatically from ISO19139 MEDIN v2.3 profile.  Not all MEDIN info is reproduced here - this conversion is intended to provide basic information to be reproduced in the NDG/MEDIN discovery service</Short_Name>    </Source_Name>    <ns0:Temporal_Coverage>       <ns0:Start_Date>2014-08-19</ns0:Start_Date>       <ns0:Stop_Date>2014-09-03</ns0:Stop_Date>    </ns0:Temporal_Coverage>    <ns0:Spatial_Coverage>       <ns0:Southernmost_Latitude>54.6152</ns0:Southernmost_Latitude>       <ns0:Northernmost_Latitude>54.6774</ns0:Northernmost_Latitude>       <ns0:Westernmost_Longitude>-1.2020</ns0:Westernmost_Longitude>       <ns0:Easternmost_Longitude>-1.0571</ns0:Easternmost_Longitude>    </ns0:Spatial_Coverage>    <ns0:Data_Center>       <ns0:Data_Center_Name>          <ns0:Short_Name>Osiris Projects</ns0:Short_Name>       </ns0:Data_Center_Name>       <ns0:Personnel>          <ns0:Role>originator</ns0:Role>          <ns0:Last_Name/>       </ns0:Personnel>    </ns0:Data_Center>    <ns0:Data_Center>       <ns0:Data_Center_Name>          <ns0:Short_Name>Osiris Projects</ns0:Short_Name>       </ns0:Data_Center_Name>       <ns0:Personnel>          <ns0:Role>custodian</ns0:Role>          <ns0:Last_Name/>       </ns0:Personnel>    </ns0:Data_Center>    <ns0:Data_Center>       <ns0:Data_Center_Name>          <ns0:Short_Name>Osiris Projects</ns0:Short_Name>       </ns0:Data_Center_Name>       <ns0:Personnel>          <ns0:Role>distributor</ns0:Role>          <ns0:Last_Name/>       </ns0:Personnel>    </ns0:Data_Center>    <ns0:Summary>Teesside Offshore Wind Farm (OWF) is a 62 MW site comprised of 27 turbines, and is owned and operated by Teesside Windfarm Limited (TWL).  Osiris Projects were contracted to provide surveys in order to monitor the seabed state, specifically the identification of seabed debris and scour or sediment accretion within the wind farm area. The survey was completed under LOGIC Terms and Conditions.  The survey works were conducted by MV Lia and were carried out between 19th August and 3rd September 2014.       The aim of the survey was:      - To identify debris within the construction area;      - To identify changes to seabed morphology, to enable the evaluation of the effectiveness of installed scour protection and ratify the predictions for scour development;      - Inform the foundation and cable maintenance schedule;      - To satisfy the requirements of the Marine License, specifically the monitoring of Archaeological Exclusion Zones.     </ns0:Summary>    <ns0:Metadata_Name>9.4</ns0:Metadata_Name>    <ns0:Metadata_Version>[CEOS IDN DIF]</ns0:Metadata_Version>    <ns0:DIF_Creation_Date>2014-10-13</ns0:DIF_Creation_Date> </ns0:DIF>
